creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings:
Collector stamp in black ink, verso lower left: H. Weber (Lugt 1383)

Collector stamp in black ink, verso lower left: A. Hubert (Lugt 130)
inscribed:
D.G.PRIN.AVR.CO:NASS.&C.AET.ANN.XXIII.AO.M.LXXXI.




Inscribed in oval around crest, upper center: UNA SOLA AURORA HA DE VENCRE MI NOCHE. 

Inscribed in margin around frame: CAROLA BVRBONIA. ... CO: NASS. &C. ... Ao CIC.LXXXI.

Signed in plate in small cartouche below frame, lower center: HGoltzius fecit.

Four lines in Latin in cartouche below frame, lower center: Huius me curae fociam, ... lustrabit lampade solis.

Four scenes in each corner, each with one line in Latin

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Hermann Weber [1817-1854, Lugt 1383]; sale of his collection Leipzig, September 17, 1855, lot 674; Alfred Gabriel Hubert [1831-1908, Lugt 130]; sale of his collection, Paris, May 25-29, 1909, lot 288; Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.
